en: Originally built as a serum laborator in 1917, this building became a museum from 1937-65 housing natural history and anthropological items, many of which had been collected by Dr. Mark Francis, first dean of the Texas A&M College of Veterinary Medicine. It also housed the mummy of Ankh-Hap, now in the Hosuton Museum of Natural Science. The museum was razed in 1972 to make way for Langford Architecture Center.
1917-1972. Was the Serum Laboratory before becoming the museum in 1937 until 1965.

Originally built as a serum laborator in 1917, this building became a museum from 1937-65 housing natural history and anthropological items, many of which had been collected by Dr. Mark Francis, first dean of the Texas A&M College of Veterinary Medicine. It also housed the mummy of Ankh-Hap, now in the Hosuton Museum of Natural Science. The museum was razed in 1972 to make way for Langford Architecture Center.

seo.title: Museum - Building History
